Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a bald man (priest?). Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating with red paint over skin areas. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz, grog, grey and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at the Naukratis terracottas workshop that was operational from the 3rd to the 2nd century BC. Similar figure style dut different subject (devotee or Harpocrates), known from Naukratis (Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-E.4768; Cambridge, Museum of Classical ArchaeologyAN1896-1908-E.4779; NA567).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.486) (Phase 1)
